Sentence.sentence: We need to accept that fact across much of the planet, so waste with little or no treatment will be used in agriculture for good reason.
Most agree that the solution is to push doctors to accept fixed payments to care for a particular illness or for a patient's needs over a year.

In fact, other recent studies have found there has never been a time in American history when so small a proportion of young people have sought or accepted leadership roles in local civic organizations.
And the head-to-head competition might give them a strong incentive to lower their prices, perhaps by accepting slimmer profit margins or demanding better deals from providers.
One analyst suggests it is necessary to accept both the positive and negative aspects of innovative products.
And because a failure to accept these increased demands indicates a lack of commitment to one's work,  the employee complies.
Though the Swedish model appears workable for most American parents, it may not be accepted by them in its entirety.
Nearly all application materials are submitted online, and the Common Application provides a one-size-fits form accepted by more than 400 schools, including the nation's most selective.
Minority Report American universities are accepting more minorities than ever
Governments in rich countries now accept that their pension and health-care promises will soon become unaffordable, and many of them have embarked on reforms, but so far only timidly.
Younger people today mostly accept that they will have to work for longer and that their pensions will be less generous
Further, children whose fathers are warm, loving, and accepting toward them have higher self-esteem and lower rates of aggression and behavior problems.
Why did you sales people accept them?
We have to accept them; otherwise, we don't get the contracts
There is no human supervision, but an attendant will be on hand to accept cash and explain the system to newly users.
By accepting the penalty clauses.
If you can accept that people from other cultures act according to their values, not yours, getting along with them will be much easier.
He is too busy to accept more responsibility
Not only had she found the highest paying job of her career, but she'd also accepted a date with the most charming men she'd ever met.
The Wallaces didn't accept advertising in the US edition until 1955 and even then they didn't allow any ads for cigarettes, liquor or drugs.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"接受，接纳"之意。
means: accept ：强调主动地或自愿地接受，或者说，经过考虑后同意接受。
receive ：着重仅仅接到或收到这一支轮船或事实，而不含采取主动或积极行动的意思。
admit ：作"接受"讲时，强调准许或批准。
take ：与receive同意，是receive的日常用法，侧重不带主观意愿地收下或接受。

stems_affixes.word_buile: de坏+cept拿,抓,握住+ive……的→拿坏的东西来→欺骗性的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 易受感染的,易受影响的
stems_affixes.word_buile: sus下+cept拿+ible能……的→能被[病]拿下→易受影响
con共同+cept拿,抓,握住→共同把握→共同的想法→观念,概念
in进入+cept拿,抓,握住+ion动作或状态→开始拿住→开端
per全部+cept拿,抓,握住+ion状态→全部抓住→理解;感知
pre预先+cept拿,抓,握住→预先拿好的话→箴言
re再+ceipt=cept抓→再次拿到→得到的收据
re再+cept拿,抓,握住+acle东西→拿东西的东西→容器
ac再+cept拿,抓,握住→一再拿→接受

Sentence.sentence: Half of the workers say their boss doesn't accept it, and only 35 percent say it's tolerated.

Sentence.sentence: He did not compromise easily, but was willing to accept any constructive advice for a worthy cause.

Sentence.sentence: It's important to learn to accept sufferings in life.

Sentence.sentence: This year, 25310 students who have accepted places in higher education institutions have put off their entry until next year, according to statistics on university entrance provided by the university and college admissions service ucas.

means.word_mean: 接受;相信;同意
其他释义
接受;同意;承认
其他释义

entry.def: If you accept something that you have been offered, you say yes to it or agree to take it.

example.ex: Eventually Sam persuaded her to accept an offer of marriage...
example.tran: 最终萨姆说服她接受了求婚。

example.ex: Your old clothes will be gratefully accepted by jumble sale organisers...
example.tran: 旧货义卖的组织者会感激地领受您捐赠的旧衣物。

entry.def: If you accept an idea, statement, or fact, you believe that it is true or valid.
entry.tran: 相信（观点、陈述、事实等）；认为…正确

example.ex: I do not accept that there is any kind of crisis in British science...
example.tran: 我不相信英国科学界有什么危机。

example.ex: I don't think they would accept that view...
example.tran: 我认为他们不会接受那种观点。

entry.def: If you accept a plan or an intended action, you agree to it and allow it to happen.

example.ex: ...Britain's reluctance to accept a proposal for a single European currency...
example.tran: 英国不愿接受单一欧洲货币的建议

example.ex: The Council will meet to decide if it should accept his resignation.
example.tran: 委员会将召开会议决定是否接受他的辞呈。

entry.def: If you accept an unpleasant fact or situation, you get used to it or recognize that it is necessary or cannot be changed.

example.ex: People will accept suffering that can be shown to lead to a greater good...
example.tran: 如果能证明眼前的苦难会带来更大的好处，人们就会愿意承受。

example.ex: Urban dwellers often accept noise as part of city life...
example.tran: 城市居民常将噪音当成城市生活的一部分。

entry.def: If a person, company, or organization accepts something such as a document, they recognize that it is genuine, correct, or satisfactory and agree to consider it or handle it.
entry.tran: 承兑，认付（单据等）；认可(文件等)

example.ex: We advised newspapers not to accept the advertising...
example.tran: 我们建议报社不要承接这项广告。

example.ex: Cheques can only be accepted up to the value guaranteed on the card...
example.tran: 支票的承兑金额不可高于卡上所担保的数额。

entry.def: If an organization or person accepts you, you are allowed to join the organization or use the services that are offered.
entry.tran: 招收，接纳（求职者、会员等)

example.ex: All-male groups will not be accepted.
example.tran: 清一色的男性团体将不被接纳。

example.ex: ...incentives to private landlords to accept young people as tenants.
example.tran: 鼓励私人房东租房给年轻人的措施

entry.def: If a person or a group of people accepts you, they begin to be friendly towards you and are happy with who you are or what you do.

example.ex: My grandparents have never had a problem accepting me...
example.tran: 我的祖父母从来都是无条件地接受我。

example.ex: Many men still have difficulty accepting a woman as a business partner...
example.tran: 许多男性仍然无法接受女性商业伙伴。

entry.def: If you accept the responsibility or blame for something, you recognize that you are responsible for it.

example.ex: The company cannot accept responsibility for loss or damage.
example.tran: 公司不承担丢失或损坏的责任。

entry.def: If you accept someone's advice or suggestion, you agree to do what they say.

example.ex: The army refused to accept orders from the political leadership...
example.tran: 军队拒绝接受政界领导层下达的命令。

example.ex: Don't automatically accept the solicitor recommended by the broker.
example.tran: 别想当然地就接受中间人推荐的诉状律师。

entry.def: If someone's body accepts a transplanted organ, the organ becomes part of the body and starts to function normally.
entry.tran: 接受并使（移植器官）发挥正常功能;不排斥

example.ex: ...drugs which will fool the body into accepting transplants.
example.tran: 能使身体顺利接受移植器官的药物

entry.def: If a machine accepts a particular kind of thing, it is designed to take it and deal with it or process it.

example.ex: The telephone booths accept 10 and 20 pence coins.
example.tran: 电话亭可使用10便士和20便士的硬币。

means.word_mean: 1. consider or hold as true;

sentences.sentence: "I cannot accept the dogma of this church"

means.word_mean: 2. receive willingly something given or offered;

sentences.sentence: "The only girl who would have him was the miller's daughter"
"I won't have this dog in my house!"

means.word_mean: 3. give an affirmative reply to; respond favorably to;
4. react favorably to; consider right and proper;

sentences.sentence: "People did not accept atonal music at that time"
"We accept the idea of universal health care"

means.word_mean: 5. admit into a group or community;

sentences.sentence: "We'll have to vote on whether or not to admit a new member"

means.word_mean: 6. take on as one's own the expenses or debts of another person;
7. tolerate or accommodate oneself to;

sentences.sentence: "I shall have to accept these unpleasant working conditions"
"She has learned to live with her husband's little idiosyncracies"

means.word_mean: 8. be designed to hold or take;

sentences.sentence: "This surface will not take the dye"

means.word_mean: 9. of a deliberative body: receive (a report) officially, as from a committee
10. make use of or accept for some purpose;
11. be sexually responsive to, used of a female domesticated mammal;

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Latin acceptare, frequentative of accipere 'take something to oneself', from ad- 'to' + capere 'take'

sentences.cn: 他承认对所发生的事负完全责任。
sentences.en: He accepts full responsibility for what happened.

sentences.cn: 最初他拒不承认有任何责任,到头来还是道了歉.
sentences.en: At first he refused to accept any responsibility but he ended up apologizing.

sentences.cn: 尼克松承认应当把对外政策的考虑放在第一位.
sentences.en: Nixon accepted the primacy of foreign policy considerations.

sentences.cn: 我承认这事的责任完全由我承担.
sentences.en: I accept that the responsibility for this lies squarely at my door.

sentences.cn: 公司已承认对货物损毁负有责任.
sentences.en: The company has accepted the liability for the damage to the cargo.

sentences.cn: 但有很多被6大区域认证机构认证的学校, 公司雇主和政府部门却不承认这些学校的学分.
sentences.en: Many regionally accredited schools, employers and government agencies, however, will not accept credits from these schools.

sentences.cn: 只要承认有原子存在,所有问题都能简单、彻底的得到解释.
sentences.en: It could all be explained quite simply and conclusively by accepting the existence of atoms.

sentences.cn: 不管你承认与否, 金钱是我们生活中不可缺少的部分.
sentences.en: Accept it or not, money is a necessary part of our life.

sentences.cn: 我承认他是个值得信任的人.
sentences.en: I accepted him as a trustworthy person.

sentences.cn: 反动派对我们的所谓承认我们是不接受的.
sentences.en: We don't accept the so called recognition given to us by the reactionaries.

sentences.cn: 她拒绝承认她错了,气愤地大步走出房间.
sentences.en: She refused to accept that she was wrong and stalked furiously out of the room.

sentences.cn: 太空人承认他们的工作中包含著危险.
sentences.en: The astronaut accepted danger was part of the job.

sentences.cn: 侯正宽 (音)承认这种变化是无法避免的.
sentences.en: Hou Zhengkuan accepted change was inevitable. " The are thinning . "

sentences.cn: 客户承认并接受以上风险以外的其他风险.
sentences.en: The Client acknowledges and accepts that there may be other risks which are not contained above.

sentences.cn: 因此,当挫折出现时就去感受一下吧. 承认它, 接受它,欢迎它.
sentences.en: So ahead and feel that frustration when it comes. Allow it, accept it and welcome it.

sentences.cn: 钻书本的历史学者现在相当勉强和冷淡地承认了它.
sentences.en: The bookish historian now accepts it, reluctantly and ungraciously enough.

sentences.cn: 除非附有证据, 科学不承认任何权威者的意见.
sentences.en: Science refuses to accept, unless accompanied by proof, the dicta of any master.

sentences.cn: 我只承认我知道的和我信任的鉴定公司的鉴定.
sentences.en: I will only accept appraisals from independent sources I know and trust.

sentences.cn: 现在人们普遍承认,虽然当时地球一片荒凉, 却在慢慢熬制着生命所须的配料.
sentences.en: It is commonly accepted that although sterile, the Earth was simmering with the ingredients life needed.

sentences.cn: 逐渐衰老是任何人都得承认的事实.
sentences.en: Growing old is something a man has to accept.

sentences.cn: 从今往后, 我须承认, 我的生命每天都在接受类似的考验.
sentences.en: From now on, I must admits that, my life are accepting such tests everyday.

sentences.cn: 法庭承认这些事实意味着怀疑是有道理的.
sentences.en: The court accepted that these facts amounted to a reasonable suspicion.

sentences.cn: 面对现实,承认失败.
sentences.en: Accept the road block and fail.

sentences.cn: 他承认我见识广.
sentences.en: He accepted me as having seen the much of the world.

sentences.cn: 您必须承认并且接受对ATP资料使用的唯一责任.
sentences.en: The requester acknowledges and accepts sole responsibility for his usage of ATP materials.

sentences.cn: 分析的一般承认方法.
sentences.en: The accepted methods of the analysis.

sentences.cn: 他们最终承认了他在学校作为一个教师的地位.
sentences.en: At last they accepted him as a teacher at the school.

sentences.cn: 我们承认并接受,我们对各地人们的命运有深远的连带关系.
sentences.en: We recognize and accept our own deep involvement in the destiny of men everywhere.

sentences.cn: 学员获得的学历学位在国内和国际都得到承认.
sentences.en: The degrees are accepted in China and other countries.

sentences.cn: 两国政府均不承认《穿鼻草约》.
sentences.en: Neither side accepted the Chuenpi terms.

sentences.cn: 他同意我们提出的全部修改方案。
sentences.en: He accepted all the changes we proposed.

sentences.en: If Facebook users were allowed a free choice, they might well tick box to accept anyway.

sentences.cn: 事实上，其他一些近期研究发现，美国历史上从来没有像现在这样，只有占比如此之少的年轻人想要获得或者愿意接受地方公民组织的领导职位。

sentences.cn: 大多数专家都认为，解决办法是推动医生接受针对某一病症或单一患者的诊疗需求的固定年度诊疗费。
sentences.en: Most agree that the solution is to push doctors to accept fixed payments to care for a particular illness or for a patient’s needs over a year.

sentences.cn: “我们得接受地球上大部分地区的这种实际情况，所以，我们有充分理由在农业生产中使用很少或根本没有经过处理的排泄物。”

Sentence.sentence: Readiness to accept new ideas helps one enjoy longevity.
It is easy to accept that genes control physical characteristics such as sex, race and eye color.
The paper provides support for newer forms of psychotherapy (心理治疗) that urge people to accept their negative thoughts and feelings rather than fight them.
But if he had accepted it, he wouldn't be able to make ends meet.
You can have a try, but as far as i know,he seldom accepts invitations from his employees Q: What can we infer about Mr
It mix all the decisions that affect the school,including rules, the timetable and accepting or rejecting new students and teachers
The creative process has always been accepted as the source of all important work in the arts, but we should not think the creativity plays a role only in the arts.
What is the widely accepted idea about the creative process
If you can accept that people from other cultures act according to their values, not yours, getting along with them will be much easier.
I cant seem to focus on anything, because 1 still haven't decided if I should accept the offer for that PhD program in London, or if I should take the job offer in New York.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section B
